author: mehdi.aouadi
content: I'm worried the API contract might be messy if it's advertising a list but always returning a single value. I guess the EL multiplexer use case is rare but shoudn't break the API if used. That's why I suggested a "hybrid" solution which might fit all use cases. Not a strong opinion though, just trying to make the API contract abstract and clear enough

author: nflaig
content:
to me the engine api design is just bad, if a multiplexer is used it should just return the version of the multiplexer, I haven't seen a practical use case why you would need multiple versions because in case of the graffiti I don't think any client puts in multiple EL versions? And generally running multiple ELs via multiplexer is not a usual node setup, I believe it's mostly useful for RPC providers to have a single beacon node coordinate multiple ELs

maybe we just don't support that on the beacon-api as it's not practical and be fine with deviating from the engine api format, ie. revert back to return a single value. I am fine either way

author: mehdi.aouadi
content: The multiplexer use case isn't standard unfortunately and it's passing some ambiguity to the end user of this API (otherwise we could have a way to determine which is the primary EL from a multiplexer). If the BN is blind, we could use a deterministic approach if we get back to the single value contract: If many ELs, consider the first one as primary for example
